change.changenote: Section 1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 290/2016, effective December 7, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Interjurisdictional Support Orders Act.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 290/2016, effective December 7, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The notice referred to in sections 9 (4) and 29 (4) of the Act must require a respondent to provide the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the respondent's response to the support application or the support variation application, as the case may be;
one of the following forms, sworn by the respondent:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the notice relates to a support application, or a support variation application in Provincial Court, Form 4 "Financial Statement" set out in the Provincial Court (Family) Rules, B.C. Reg. 417/98;
if the notice relates to a support variation application in Supreme Court, Form F8, "Financial Statement", set out in the Supreme Court Family Rules, B.C. Reg. 169/2009.

change.changenote: Section 2 (1) (b) (i) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 23/2021, effective May 17, 2021.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the notice relates to a support application or support variation application in the Provincial Court, Form 4 "Financial Statement" of the Provincial Court (Family) Rules, B.C. Reg. 417/98, or a form similar to that form;

change.changenote: Section 2.1 was enacted by BC Reg 23/2021, effective February 1, 2021.
Section 3 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the evidence on which the applicant is relying to support his or her application to set aside the registration of the foreign order.

change.changenote: Section 4 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 23/2021, effective February 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 25 (3) (e) of the Act, the applicant must include a statement that sets out in detail,

change.changenote: Section 5 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 303/2012, effective October 12, 2012.

section.sectiontext: For the purposes of section 39 of the Act, the designated authority must convert an amount that is not expressed in Canadian currency by applying the rate of conversion, as determined by the Provincial Treasury, that was applicable on

paragraph.paragraphtext: the date the order was made, if the order has not been varied,
the date of the last variation of the order, if the order has been varied, or
the date the document was executed, if the document is not an order.

change.changenote: Section 5.1 was enacted by BC Reg 275/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Section 5.2 was enacted by BC Reg 275/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Section 6, Schedule item 6.2 was added by BC Reg 303/2012, effective October 12, 2012.
